hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Liquidity Rotation into Altcoins Post-BTC Consolidation
hypothesis_content.statement: After BTC consolidates in a ±1.5% range for 48+ hours during NEUTRAL regime, the next BTC breakout (>1%) triggers asymmetric liquidity rotation into mid-cap alts (market cap $1B-$10B), generating 2:1 alt/BTC returns over 24 hours with 65% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Consolidation accumulates latent liquidity. Breakouts signal risk-on rotation. Mid-cap alts offer higher beta during liquidity expansion. Current neutral regime with pending bull run speculation creates ideal conditions.
entry_conditions: BTC breaks consolidation with >1% move on >150% volume
Altcoin dominance index (excl ETH) at 30-day lows

exit_conditions.take_profit: Selected altcoin basket outperforms BTC by 2:1 ratio OR 24 hours elapsed
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC retraces back into consolidation range (±1.5% from breakout)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Altcoin basket fails to achieve 2:1 outperformance vs BTC within 36 hours for >55% of signals in neutral regime across 150+ historical consolidation breakouts.
